subject: Golf
lead_paragraph: Scott Verplank shot his second consecutive eight-under-par 64 to take a three-stroke lead in the Children’s Miracle Network Classic at Disney World, the final official PGA Tour event of the season. Steve Marino (66) and Troy Matteson (68) were tied for second, but the real drama was further down in the standings. Erik Compton, who had his second heart transplant six months ago and was playing on a sponsor’s exemption, shot a 68 and made the cut by two strokes.
